<jobs>
    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Data Analyst]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
605 is an independent TV measurement and analytics firm that offers advertising and content measurement, full-funnel attribution, media planning, optimization and analytical solutions. Comprised of engineers, analysts, data scientists, media experts and marketing strategists, 605 forges new paths using groundbreaking innovations that set industry standards for audience targeting and measurement.
  

  
605 is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to help develop solutions, codes and reports which solve the questions most pressing to the TV and media industry. Being able and excited to analyze large and messy data is part of the job, as is having the skills to flexibly work on a variety of tasks to maintain project success. As an Associate Data Analyst you will be responsible for improving methods and efficiencies across the team, developing reports, project management, hands-on coding and cross team collaboration.
  

  
A Data Analyst’s day-to-day tasks would include:
  

  
 
  
+ Working independently or collaboratively on large and complex data science problems and analyses
  
 
  
+ Applying or adapting methods to new problems, and developing new tools as needed
  
 
  
+ Coding original R/Python/Spark scripts as well as optimizing current scripts
  
 
  
+ Developing reports to convey analytics findings to a client facing audience
  
 
  
+ Working with client/sales team to build new business opportunities
  
 
  

  
Requirements
  

  
 
  
+ 2+ years work experience
  
 
  
+ 2+ years of coding and specifically 1+ years in R/Python coding; proficiency with SQL
  
 
  
+ Undergraduate degree (preferably in a quantitative field)
  
 
  
+ Strong understanding and application of statistics, logic and problem solving
  
 
  
+ Able and excited to analyze large and messy data
  
 
  
+ Strict integrity, able to work with confidential, private, and high-value client information
  
 
  
+ Intellectual flexibility to adapt existing tools, algorithms, methods to new needs
  
 
  
+ Can balance workload across a variety of different projects over the course of a week
  
 
  
+ Find stable threads to explore within amorphous and changing business problems
  
 
  
+ Strong ability to communicate about data structure and characteristics, analytical techniques, statistical findings, and solutions to a variety of audiences using data visualization and reporting tools such as ggplot2, matplotlib, Shiny, etc.
  
 
  
+ Excellent written skills to translate results to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences through white papers; reports; and internal, external, and client-facing presentations
  
 
  

  

  

  

  
Preferred Skills:
  

  
 
  
+ Master's degree in a quantitative field
  
 
  
+ Experience working in analytics in the entertainment industry or in television or digital marketing
  
 
  
+ Design and analysis of experiments
  
 
  
+ Analysis of high-dimensional time series or event stream data
  
 
  
+ Adapting, implementing, and scaling various machine learning techniques
  
 
  
+ Previous experience with Databricks (or other distributed computing environments) and familiarity with Spark SQL and Scala
  
 
  

  
Benefits
  

  
 
  
+ Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance for employees and their families
  
 
  
+ Company-paid life insurance, short and long term disability
  
 
  
+ 401k with match
  
 
  
+ Pre-tax flexible compensation plan for medical, transit, parking or dependent care expenses
  
 
  
+ Generous vacation, personal and sick days
  
 
  
+ Hybrid work model with 3-4 days remote per week
  
 
  
+ 100% paid parental and family caregiving leave
  
 
  
+ Educational reimbursement program
  
 
  
+ A kitchen stocked with sodas, snacks, yogurt and other goodies
  
 
  
+ A tight-knit startup community who likes to eat! We celebrate everyone’s birthdays, have frequent team lunches, and do events in and out of the office
  
 
  
+ 605 is an active participant in conferences

    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Sr. Security Engineer]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
605 is an independent TV measurement and analytics firm that offers advertising and content measurement, full-funnel attribution, media planning, optimization and analytical solutions. Comprising engineers, analysts, data scientists, media experts and marketing strategists, 605 forges new paths using groundbreaking innovations that set industry standards for audience targeting and measurement.
  

  
Reporting to the VP, IT & Information Security, the Sr. Security Engineer will help implement 605’s information security program, consisting of cloud infrastructure, on-premise networking, and end-user endpoints. The Sr. Security Engineer will be directly responsible for implementing and managing cloud and on-premise firewalls and the various security tools to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the 605 environment. 
  
 
  
Clear, concise communication of goals and issues up and down is key to the success of this role, as are strong organizational skills. The Sr. Security Engineer must have demonstrable ability to anticipate roadblocks, research solutions, present solutions to management and stakeholders, and manage implementation. You might be meeting with senior management in one moment, and then going deep with our technology team ten minutes later. It is critical that the Sr. Security Engineer is able to go deep technically, as well as explain quantified risks in lay-terms. We run a well-oiled machine and we all lean in - and on - each other, as we are highly collaborative.
  
 
  
Specific responsibilities include:
  

  
 
  
+ Works with the Information Security team to implement and maintain all security services and infrastructure, with special emphasis on cloud technologies and tools to integrate into a CI/CD development and container-based (Kubernetes and Amazon AWS EKS) environments
  
 
  
+ Works with IT and DevOps teams to apply appropriate patches and system hardening procedures including updating necessary firmware on all systems to ensure the network remains secure from unauthorized access
  
 
  
+ Troubleshoots issues and provides hands-on support as needed, to ensure smooth and efficient operation of security systems. This will include Linux servers, Mac and Windows workstations.
  
 
  
+ Monitors established network and security controls to ensure compliance with Information Security policies. Must have a command of NIST, CIS, and ISO security frameworks.
  
 
  
+ Must be hands-on, with a strong technical ability to perform security engineering and operations functions as part of this role.
  
 
  

  
Requirements
  

  
Hands-on working knowledge with the following technologies:
  

  
 
  
+ Managing and Securing SaaS-based Solutions
  
 
  
+ Administration and Engineering of Palo Alto firewalls (physical and virtual). VPN setup and administration (P2P and GlobalProtect end-point clients).
  
 
  
+ Linux operating systems installation and troubleshooting (AWS-Linux2 and Ubuntu)
  
 
  
+ System hardening and infrastructure security
  
 
  
+ AWS security configuration, including IAM roles, security groups, EC2 instance creation, S3 bucket policies, JSON creation, VPC engineering, and Cloud Trails setup and auditing
  
 
  
+ Cisco Meraki wireless controllers configuration and management
  
 
  
+ Cylance end-point protection (Protect / Optics) troubleshooting
  
 
  
+ Splunk Cloud: dashboard creation and monitoring
  
 
  
+ Vulnerability scanning tools such as Tenable’s Security Center, Nessus
  
 
  
+ VMware WorkspaceOne (Airwatch) / JAMF/ scripting experience
  
 
  
+ Duo MFA implementations and integrations
  
 
  
+ Email protection solutions such as Proofpoint Enterprise
  
 
  

  

  

  

  
Preferred Skills and Qualifications
  

  
 
  
+ Experience with integrating LDAP, SAML, federated identity services and MFA services
  
 
  
+ Penetration testing tools such as Burp Suite, Metasploit, Nmap, Aircrack-ng, Kali Linux
  
 
  
+ Implementation and setup of static and dynamic code assessment tools
  
 
  
+ Bachelor’s Degree in Computers Science, Management Information Systems, Cybersecurity or equivalent
  
 
  
+ Experience with VDI: Citrix or AWS Workspaces
  
 
  
+ Experience in big data and/or media and advertising a plus
  
 
  
+ Experience with managed services and SaaS solutions a plus
  
 
  
+ CEH, CCNP, CCIE, TIA Security+, LPIC2, or similar Linux certifications. 5 – 7 years hands-on with network/systems engineering and security systems.
  
 
  

  
Additional Notes
  

  
+ Occasional travel to NYC or LI (whichever is the non-primary office).
  

  

  
Benefits
  

  
 
  
+ Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance for employees and their families
  
 
  
+ Company-paid life insurance, short and long term disability
  
 
  
+ 401k with match
  
 
  
+ Pre-tax flexible compensation plan for medical, transit, parking or dependent care expenses
  
 
  
+ Generous vacation, personal and sick days
  
 
  
+ Hybrid work model with 3-4 days remote per week
  
 
  
+ 100% paid parental and family caregiving leave
  
 
  
+ Educational reimbursement program
  
 
  
+ A k
